params.feesAccrued: the fees accrued by the position if liquidity was decreased
params.liquidity: the amount of liquidity decreased in the position, may be 0
params.owner: the current owner of the tokenId
params.tokenId: the token ID of the position

notifyModifyLiquidity(uint256,int256,int.details: Note that feesAccrued can be artificially inflated by a malicious user Pools with a single liquidity position can inflate feeGrowthGlobal (and consequently feesAccrued) by donating to themselves; atomically donating and collecting fees within the same unlockCallback may further inflate feeGrowthGlobal/feesAccrued

params.feesAccrued: the fees to be collected from the position as a result of the modifyLiquidity call
params.liquidityChange: the change in liquidity on the underlying position
params.tokenId: the token ID of the position

params.data: additional data passed in by the caller
params.tokenId: the token ID of the position

notifyUnsubscribe(uint256).details: This call's gas is capped at `unsubscribeGasLimit` (set at deployment)Because of EIP-150, solidity may only allocate 63/64 of gasleft()

params.tokenId: the token ID of the position

notifyBurn(uint256,address,uint256,uint2.notice: Called when a position is burned

notifyModifyLiquidity(uint256,int256,int.notice: Called when a position modifies its liquidity or collects fees

notifySubscribe(uint256,bytes).notice: Called when a position subscribes to this subscriber contract

notifyUnsubscribe(uint256).notice: Called when a position unsubscribes from the subscriber

documentation.text:
@title ISubscriber
 @notice Interface that a Subscriber contract should implement to receive updates from the v4 position manager
